H0.text: Seafloor spreading creates new seafloor in the rift valleys.

H1.text: Sedimentation creates new seafloor in the rift valleys.

H2.text: Crust spreading creates new seafloor in the rift valleys.

H3.text: Continental drift creates new seafloor in the rift valleys.

A4.text: At a spreading center, basaltic magma rises up the fractures and cools on the ocean floor to form new seabed.

A5.text: At the Mid-Atlantic Ridge (and in other mid-ocean ridges), material from the upper mantle rises through the faults between oceanic plates to form new crust as the plates move away from each other, a phenomenon first observed as continental drift.
